body_html:
This now implements the "nicer" solution described above, with the different that the Type is now the first argument (although that is not a strict requirement) to match the _out variants. So the call order is now:
at::ones(dtype, shape) -> dtype.ones(shape) -> CPUFloatType.ones(shape) -> at::native::ones(*this, shape)
body_text:
This now implements the "nicer" solution described above, with the different that the Type is now the first argument (although that is not a strict requirement) to match the _out variants.  So the call order is now:
at::ones(dtype, shape) -> dtype.ones(shape) -> CPUFloatType.ones(shape) -> at::native::ones(*this, shape)
body:
This now implements the "nicer" solution described above, with the different that the Type is now the first argument (although that is not a strict requirement) to match the _out variants.  So the call order is now:
at::ones(dtype, shape) -> dtype.ones(shape) -> CPUFloatType.ones(shape) -> at::native::ones(*this, shape)
